summary: Diff adds a full React frontend flow (planner form, discovery, recommendations, exports, past schedules drawer, bilingual toggle) and a Motoko backend actor with schedule/profile/quick-buy storage and authorization. However, the map implementation does not appear to meet the requested interactive map behavior, and several unrequested authorization/profile/admin-token mechanisms were introduced.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add a map visualization that plots the user location and discovered shops, and allows selecting a shop from the map to view details using a React-compatible map library.
missing_requirements.reason: The added MapView renders an OpenStreetMap embed iframe and a separate list of shop cards, but does not plot per-shop markers on the map nor support selecting a shop by clicking a map marker. It also does not appear to use a React map library (it uses an iframe embed).

hallucinated_features.description: Role-based access control / admin initialization via secret token parameter (caffeineAdminToken) and authorization mixins.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only specifies persistence in a single Motoko actor and (if needed) Internet Identity; it does not request role-based authorization layers or admin secret token bootstrapping via URL parameters.

hallucinated_features.description: User profile management (name, preferredLocation, defaultBudget) and a forced profile setup dialog after login.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest focuses on shopping schedule planning, discovery, exports, and bilingual UI; it does not request user profile creation/setup flows.
